actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and Office of Management and Budget.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of May 18, 89 without amendment. With written report No. 101-34.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 72.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources received executive comment from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Power.
Committee on Energy and Commerce discharged.
Mr. Sharp asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Considered by unanimous consent.
The House struck all after the enacting clause and inserted in lieu thereof the provisions of a similar measure H.R. 3021. Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed without objection.
The title of the measure was amended to that of similar measure H.R. 3021. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
A similar measure H.R. 3021 was laid on the table without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendments by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-155.

official_title: A bill extending time limitations on certain projects.

summary.text: Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to extend, for up to three consecutive two-year periods, the time required for specified licensees to commence construction on certain small hydroelectric generation facilities located in: (1) Independence County, Arkansas; and (2) Whatcom and Lewis Counties, Washington.

titles.title: A bill extending time limitations on certain projects.
